intro: Tricalysia kirkii var. australis, commonly known as the Australian tricalysia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
